climbs.name: Trepidation
climbs.fa: J. Whidden, B. Middleton, D. Kloke, 2003

content.description:
If you're looking for an intense 5.7, this is the climb for you. Sustained steep slab climbing past 3 bolts to an easy finish.

Variation: Continue up the off-width (5.9) past the 4th bolt above the chains, finish at 'Gription' chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chains. 5.9 extension has extra bolt.
content.location:
Sunset Slab South

First route right of the large vegetation next to the wall (almost directly behind it). Follow trail down right at fork just before 'Gription', then curve back uphill once next to the wall again.

content.description: Slab. Suspenseful given the fact that it is run out after last bolt and no anchor in sight. You need to traverse left towards the Hold on Don't Give Up anchor, then you'll find your anchor tucked away to the right of it. The traverse is low 5th class.
content.location: Bolted line to the right of Hold On, Don't Give Up. The last bolt you see will have plenty of rock above it with its anchor not in sight.

climbs.name: Hold On, Don't Give Up!
climbs.fa: J. Whidden, B. Middleton, D. Kloke 2003

content.location: Sixth bolt line from left on Sunset Slab South. Immediately right of Trepidation.

content.description: Start right of the large break in the wall, climbing steep slab past two bolts (crux) to a large ledge. Pass the third bolt on the left, stepping across to the other wall, then continuing up a low angle slab. Traverse right at last bolt to the anchor.
content.location:
Sunset Slab South

Just right of a gully/break in wall, left of large vegetation next to wall.

content.description: 5 bolts, big holds. Shares anchors with Buried Treasure. Right side of route is mossy and stays wet longer than most of the slab.
content.location: Farthest route right on the south slab. There is a hand line between two bolts to reach the belay ledge.

content.description: Slab. Start on unstable ground. Recommend clipping into the belay bolt at first due to potential fall hazard and then traversing over left to start and climb your way back right to the first bolt. Pretty straightforward after that.
content.protection: 4 bolts and anchor with quick clips.
content.location: Second route from right. Above the steep loose trail that descends into the forest. Has a belay bolt.
